situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The fish pays money to the wolf. The goat falls on a square of the wolf. The wolf has a 10 x 17 inches notebook, and is a school principal. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If the wolf has a notebook that fits in a 13.3 x 20.6 inches box, then the wolf calls the reindeer. Rule2: The wolf will call the reindeer if it (the wolf) works in marketing. Rule3: If something calls the reindeer and swears to the ant, then it swims in the pool next to the house of the dragonfly. Rule4: In order to conclude that the wolf swears to the ant, two pieces of evidence are required: firstly the fish should pay some $$$ to the wolf and secondly the goat should fall on a square that belongs to the wolf.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the wolf swim in the pool next to the house of the dragonfly?
label: proved
